title: Crit & Choice Needed for Logo
content:
Ok so I’ve been considering getting an established logo going but there are so many good choices out there. I’ve narrowed it down to 4 different ones that I like.

I’m a freelance web designer but the site is basically non-important drivel and banter ... so take that into account when considering which choice. It needs to be professional enough to look like I didn’t slap Arial on there, but cute / playful enough to fit the style of my site. Check out [the site](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821152435/http:/tinycrumb.com/home) for a better idea of the style I’m going for.

Also, along with which choice, I’d appreciate any critique on them individually, e.g., if Kerning is off on one particular one, if one choice is just really bad type-wise, etc...

I am a noob though so please be nice :)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Choices](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821152435/http:/typophile.com/files/choices.png) | 15.28 KB |

 [‹ \*\*\*PLEASE COMMENT ON MY TYPE\*\*\*\*](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821152435/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41246 "Go to previous forum topic") [Critique for new Web Design agency portfolio/website ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821152435/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41202 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Joshua

comments.content: I like the closed C and rounded r of number 2. I don’t understand the name. You might think about the name some more. Ask yourself will a client get it?

Dan,

A client is not supposed to get it. Its just the name of my blog. And the name stays :) It means something to me.

Thanks for the suggestion though. #2 is a favorite of mine too, I just can’t decide.

Any more?
After looking at the site... I vote for 4. It fits.
